name: william
text: yes it is very important that you do not have sex with or use the same needles as the McAfrica

name: aperson
text: If you order the McAfrica, you can't donate blood ever again.

name: wonelove
text: is there...paperwork involved?

name: mrtatulas
text: Really, this should apply to anything eaten at McDonalds.

name: cailetshadow
text: Why oh why did someone have to screw the (68% monkey meat) McAfrica pita?!

name: shinkusan
text: I believe you mean "McMonkey" brand monkey meat. Sir.

name: dirtyantaeus
text: A comment left by dirtyantaeus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mortshire, TheLoneliestMonkey, ravindra108, nutmeg, erinye, clintisiceman, slalvation, Darthemed)

name: deimosrising
text: It's the Lone Star State, holmes.

name: hannah
text: at this point in time/the archive, i feel i should note that there are so far 30 of us who are clearly going through from the beginning and rating every damn strip. godspeed you, my brothers.

name: centipede_damascus
text: That is exactly what I am doing. Race you to the end!

name: equinn2006
text: Hell yes.

name: deimosrising
text: dammit equinn you're ahead of me. I haven't had a computer for days!

name: equinn2006
text: I'm just trying to reconcile the fact that I'm a Huggins-come-lately by reading/rating every strip.

name: whitey
text: I've been re-reading and rating every strip in my own fashion.  I click on the "You haven't seen these highest rated" link.  I suppose that I'm reading from the top down in a way.

name: thatskotkid
text: It's the only way to fly.

name: charchar
text: Wow, is it depressing to read that under 9 months ago . Sweet time, hurrying me until I catch up.

name: foetus_punch
text: This is the third time I've done that in as many weeks. A life? Nah, I don't one of those. I've got achewood, guys.

name: crankheart
text: you're not alone, fellow magritte fan :P

name: hellaedgar
text: I am one of those.

name: shogun
text: Four months late. I don't suppose there's anybody hanging around to punch my waypoint card? Maybe a little Gatorade?

name: rowboat
text: Yeah, these guys thought they were greenhorns. Now we're basically walkin' on their fossils.

name: mastronaut
text: showed up to the party 4 hours late with almost no sauce.

name: bixschmix
text: As our elders have blazed the path before us, so we go.

name: snowman
text: all coming across skeletal remains of previous explorers, skewered on booby trap spikes.  all using a map that your great-uncle partially completed before he died.

name: pogo
text: Yeah, I wonder if any of those early wankers are still kickin'.

name: gtc
text: Our time too shall pass. Generations, yet unborn, with usernames unpronouncable and avatars bearing patterns forged on uncanny computers will, one day, try to decipher the languages our comments are written in - html and BBcode will mean nought to these our children's children.

name: belgand
text: And as we pass we must scrawl our pithy comments into the walls. Daubing paint into crude drawings to describe our passing as if to say that we matter. That we too came past and had our time, made our mark, and chubbied the chub-worthy.

name: cagliostro
text: Chubbied seven months later for essentially summarising human existence.

name: belgand
text: That was the joke, yo. Assetbar be hella microcosm of all that ever was and ever shall be.

name: greenkoolayd
text: HERESY!!!!!!

name: snowman
text: I'm a little proud I'm currently in the middle of doing the same, but almost a year later.

name: donnatron
text: same here!

name: terrordactyl
text: uh yeah i am too but i signed up late? i've been reading the comments it's been a pleasure gentlemen

name: sargasm
text: Christ if those sides don't look delicious.  Broccoli Cheese Nuggets?  Maui Cheese Potatoes?  All we have here is fries.  Why, McDonald's?

name: everything_is_a_hat
text: because, McDonald's hates us, that's why. They do not wish for us to have delicious Broccoli Cheese Nuggets or Maui Cheese Potatoes.

name: overmedicated
text: Broccoli Cheese nuggets sound, frankly, revolting.

name: ovenface
text: McDonalds sounds, frankly, revolting.

name: kyrasmash
text: Some of the best McDonald's can be have in Berlin. Amazing hangover food.

name: tekende
text: Every freaking time I have a hangover my immediate instinct is to have McDonald's for lunch. I have learned to repress this urge, because McDonald's lunch when hungover causes nasty things to happen in the toilet later.

name: kyrasmash
text: Such is the life of the drinking man.

name: hannah
text: it has to be said that i'm enjoying the archive race.

name: petro
text: If the carful reader will note, these are XTRA special items, not available all at once. As Onstad was there on 28 August, they were only serving the grilled Texas bagel. (Also note: non-kosher) Were they out of the Maui cheese potatoes, or were they hiding it?

name: lizjones
text: Actually, it looks like they were already on to the McAfrica. Hello, HIV!

name: petro
text: Touch�,

name: rotating-dog
text: What is so odd about a "Grilled Texas Bagel"?

name: cdl146
text: When have you ever heard the words "Texas" and "Bagel" in the same sentence? Of the things one commonly associates with Texas (steers, queers, etc.) bagels do not generally come to mind.

name: rotating-dog
text: I see! Combined with some research, this makes more sense. Some of these jokes are a little harder for us non-American types to grasp first try.

name: cdl146
text: I suppose this just goes to prove the point he's trying to make. Where are you from, if you don't mind my asking? Until this forum, I never realized Achewood had much of an international following.

name: rotating-dog
text: I guess it does! I'm from New Zealand, Australia's Canada.

name: jdhenry105
text: I've always thought of Australia as America's floating Canada.

name: relaxing
text: Australia is America's rude Canada.

name: relaxing
text: That's rude as in 'Ruuuuude titties', lamers.

name: semiquaver
text: I always thought of America as Canada's Mexico.  Then again, I'm from Portland, OR.

name: charchar
text: I just heard that said in Colbert's voice.  I think I need therapy...

name: semiquaver
text: I assume because that's something he'd NEVER SAY.

name: charchar
text: no..the therapy was more an aside to myself...I should also get some lettuce.

name: semiquaver
text:
-Milk
-Cheese and/or Butter
-Pancake mix
-Therapy
-Brownie mix

name: greenkoolayd
text: i laughed so hard that i almost wet myself.

name: joeyramoney
text: i think it's englands' floating canada.

name: cailetshadow
text: England is Australia's tiny landlocked Canada.

name: jdhenry105
text: Are you suggesting that England is landlocked?

name: madnes
text: cailetshadow is jdhenry105's Canada.

name: ovenface
text: Somebody from Canada found this whole conversation pretty lame.

name: cailetshadow
text:
wow. yes. yes i was.

i believe this is one of the early signs of late-onset mental retardation. 0_0

name: rotating-dog
text: The Canada is different for everyone.

name: relaxing
text: There is no Canada.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: aw. i chubbied you before i saw it as a Matrix parallel...that isn't what you were doing, is it?

name: relaxing
text: it may have been?  this thread has reached the point where all replies get squashed and it's hard to who was replying to what.

name: trollcollins
text: Canada is totally a made-up place!

name: _cheesekayke
text: No, that's Belgium.

name: rowboat
text: I'm not sure about that, but the use of emoticons certainly is.

name: semiquaver
text: The early signs of late-onset mental retardation is the late signs of early-onset mental retardation's Canada.

name: mattylite
text: In soviet Texas late-onset emoticons are the floating Canadian bagels of England's Africa.

name: rowboat
text: *splut*

name: greenkoolayd
text: yyou lost me at soviet....

name: troy_convers
text:
"England is Australia's tiny landlocked Canada."
Guess who failed Geography class. Tosser.

name: _cheesekayke
text: No, man, Americans have no problem with Australia. Canada is mocked because it is thought of as the uncool little brother who tries so hard to be like you. Australia is the wacky uncle.

name: tekende
text: Actually, Canada seems to try very hard to NOT be like the US.

name: _cheesekayke
text: In recent years, sure, but that's not saying much. The bald fuckin' eagle is trying to distance himself from America right now. Who can blame them for wanting to be Europe?

name: geysershitdick
text: A bagel is basically a jewish thing, and not that jews hates Texas or Texas hates jews, but they don't really mix.

name: presterjohn
text: Texans and Jews have never been able to agree re: proper size of silly hats.

name: semiquaver
text: I saw this first as "billy hats," analogous to "jimmy hats."  After I mentally corrected myself, my first thought was re: circumcision.  I am a fucked up li'l puppy.

name: heccibiggs
text: I am laughing so much in the middle of the office right now, fuck yoooooou

name: semiquaver
text: Thanks to Texas' relaxed attitude towards campaign finance law and voting, Jews elect half of their elected representatives.  That would include Charles Wilson, according to the movie.

name: relaxing
text: Bagels belong in urban areas with significant Jewish populations.  Texas is mostly desert or plains with significant Cowboy and Mexican populations.

name: ovenface
text: Plus, meals in Texas are made of a high percentage of meat. Bagels do not contain any meat. A thin McDonalds hamburger patty does not make up for a bagel's lack of meat.

name: charchar
text: In Texas, we had our own size a Dairy Queen. It's called Texasize. Ordering Texasize soda is like saying, "I hope my small loud child drowns on account'a accident ." (This is a mostly true story re: Texan narcissism. I have about four more.)

name: relaxing
text: Please continue.

name: charchar
text:
-Ford trucks have their own "Texas Edition." I'm not sure what's different beyond the little Lone Star insignia on the fender.
-In Texas schools, after the pledge of allegiance one recites the Texas State Pledge. It goes thusly:
I pledge allegiance
To thee, Texas
One state,
Under God*
Indivisible
(*this revision was made just last year)
-Textbooks are marked "Texas Edition." Again, I am not sure how they are different.
-Dairy Queen also has a special Texas jingle. It just goes "Deeeee-Cueeee
That's what I like about Texas."
So yeah, strange place, Texas.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
Maybe textbooks are the Texas-edition because all the textbooks are the same there?

My sophomore history teacher said that that's why a lot of textbooks bend the truth; they want the big buys from Texas and California.

name: tekende
text: I wish to move to Texas now. A state so arrogant and self-centered greatly appeals to me for some reason.

name: mr_lostman28
text:
Texas also has its own self proclaimed "National Beer"
Lone Star

Also Ford and Chevy continually fight over the Texas truck market by hiring country musicians to write songs to about trucks or rewrite segments to mention thier truck.

name: troy_convers
text: No need. You're American.

name: tekende
text: And you're a douchebag, apparently.

name: finish_him
text:
Texas is America's America.

America is Texas' Canada?

name: rogergs
text: First Toto, now McDonalds. Africa got some image problems the G8 ain't even know about.

name: nighttoad
text: i wish i could somehow prove to you that i was listening to "africa" when i read your comment. you're just going to have to trust me on this one. also, i met someone this weekend who home brews beer and named it toto, after the band. what an exciting series of coincidences!

name: evolume
text: "Broccolli," "Cheese," and "Nuggets" are words that should never ever be used to describe any 1 food item in any country.

name: zem
text:
seriously pick any two and they clash
well, maybe some people would go in for broccoli plus cheese but not me

name: _cheesekayke
text: I love broccoli with cheese.

name: relaxing
text: Cheese and broccoli go together.  This is an undeniable fact.

name: tekende
text: Yes, but not in nugget form, I fear.

name: lamewad
text:
Am I the only one with the sneaking suspicion that the pictures of food are indeed doctored? I mean, look at the thumbtacks.
Or was that totally implied and I missed it?

name: echidnaboy
text: Well spotted! I think it's a genuine poster which is designed to resemble a note board with cards pinned to it. The artifice is not Onstad's but German McDonalds'.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
It's a poster, you're right, but I wouldn't be surprised of the names were doctored by Onstad:

- why are the menu items all in English? There are conceivable reasons why they could be, but it still makes me wonder.
- who the hell would call something McAfrica?

But it's mainly just that the words look a little photoshopped to me, can't really say why. Still funny, though.

name: fermatprime
text: The McAfrica was totally real .

name: cpnglxynchos
text: have you never seen epic thumbtacks like those pictured..?

name: pogo
text: Yes, they are called "pushpins" and are very big in the graphic arts and advertising.  Those are cool ones cast from aluminum or some metal.  Most are plastic.  The metal ones can be thrown like darts into a cork wall, if you have the right grip.

name: catgrl131
text:
AH-HA! Why does the "Berlin train station" have a door mat for such a thing as to wipe your feet on, what appears to be small potted plant, the edge of a wooden table (I think), and a tile floor behind a glass door?

Think about it, people!

name: tekende
text: Maybe there's a McDonald's inside the train station, much the same way as there are eateries inside airports and malls?

name: crankheart
text: despite the fact that all of those food choices scare me...it still looks better than the american menu.

name: subrosian
text:
I cannot escape the feeling these products were invented by an American with a dim understanding of geography. The McAfrica looks like it has McAids, and entrusting a fast food restaurant with pineapple (Honolulu Chicken) is simply a Poor Decision.

However, I cannot help but feel a surge of connectivity with my fellow man. For anywhere I go in the world, if I see someone carrying a McDonalds bag, I simply know. We can look at each other and know, that yes, last night, we drank too many dogg, we have celebrated too much, too soon, and this is our punishment.
